subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Stretch-Shortening Cycle
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Stretch-Shortening Cycle.

hook.text: Jump higher by dipping first. Throw harder by winding up. Your muscles store energy like rubber bands.

buildup.text: When a muscle stretches under load, elastic energy stores in tendons. The quick reversal releases it.

discovery.text: This is the stretch-shortening cycle. It adds 'free' force on top of what muscles produce alone.

twist.text: Pause too long between stretch and contraction and the stored energy dissipates as heat. Speed matters.

climax.text: Plyometric training ‚Äî box jumps, bounds, throws ‚Äî specifically trains this elastic recoil.

punchline.text: Your tendons are springs. Train them and you get free power.
